h.	Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR)
NovaStar has a Pre-startup Safety Review program for the Covered Process. The facility performs Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications of the Covered Process. The reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe start-up prior to placing equipment into operation. A completed PSSR is required prior to introducing hazardous materials to the process.
i.	Compliance Audits
The last compliance audit for the facility was completed in July 2023. NovaStar will conduct compliance audits every three years. 
j.	Incident Investigation
NovaStar investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of formaldehyde. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation (conditions and causes) leading to the incident as well as corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. Incident Investigation reports related to the Covered Process are retained for a minimum of five years. 
k.	Employee Participation 
NovaStar has developed a written employee participation plan. Employees at the Midland are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend measures for improvement.  
l.	Contractors 
NovaStar trains contract employees on potential hazards related to the contractor's work and the Covered Process. Contractors are also informed of the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of formaldehyde occur while they are present. 
4.	Five-year Accident History
There have been no accidents that resulted in the release of the covered chemicals within the 5-year tracking period.
5.	Emergency Response Program

mation on the worst-case and alternative-case release scenarios is maintained in the Midland facility.

c.	Process Hazardous Analysis (PHA)

NovaStar conducted PHA studies to identify hazards associated with its Covered Process and to verify appropriate controls were in place. These studies were undertaken by teams of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations. Findings and recommendations related to the latest PHAs have been addressed by the facility. The facility plans to address recommendations made during the PHA by December 31, 2023. The most recent PHA for the Covered Process was completed in April 2023. 

d.   Operating Procedures
NovaStar maintains written operating procedures to safely conduct activities in the Covered Process. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown, and startup after a turnaround. 

e.	Training 

NovaStar has a training program for employees tasked with operational processes and procedures. NovaStar maintains records of the training provided to employees.

f.	Mechanical Integrity
NovaStar has a preventive maintenance program for equipment in the Covered Process. NovaStar carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operation. Covered Process equipment examined during these checks includes, among others: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps.  Equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Risk Management Plan (RMP) Executive Summary  NovaStar LP 
NovaStar LP (NovaStar) is required to develop a RMP for the formaldehyde solution stored and processed at the Midland Facility located in Midland, Texas hereafter referred to as the Covered Process. 
As required by 40 CFR 68.155, NovaStar developed this RMP Executive Summary for the subject process.
1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Release Policies
Novastars policy is to respond to emergencies and minimize employee exposure and potential injury. This is done through training of onsite personnel and contractors working on the site, the use of various safeguards to control hazards associated with potentially hazardous work, and the use of alarms during operations to detect anomalies in process operations.
The emergency response plan is to notify local first responders of the emergency, provide NovaStar personnel with an evacuation plan, and then provide technical assistance to authorities as needed. NovaStar reviews and updates its policy annually. 

2.	Facility and Regulated Substances

Novastar has one regulated substance at the Midland facility. The facility is a chemical manufacturing and distribution plant that manufactures chemicals and distributes release chemicals to other manufactures as well as end users primarily in the oil & gas industry. 
The process uses formaldehyde solution, to produce a variety of products.
The facility is subject to Program Level 3 RMP requirements. [The OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation also applies to the facility because the quantity of formaldehyde onsite exceeds the PSM trigger limit of 1,000 pounds.]
3.	Release Prevention Program at the Midland Plant. 

a.	Process Safety Information (PSI)
NovaStar maintains a Process Safety Information (PSI) record that describes chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment design associated with the regulated substance and Covered Process.
